Title: Source 1a. Hot Pack Investigation 1
Content: A student investigated how volume affects how the temperature of a substance changes, by following these steps:

:ibox:1. Place an instant hot pack in the bottom of a cardboard box.

2. Put a layer of aluminum foil on top of the hot pack.

3. Place a tight-fitting cardboard divider in the box on top of the foil to create four sections.

4. Add a different volume of room-temperature water to each jar.

5. Place one jar in each section, as shown in FIGURE 1.
The cardboard box was sealed and the water was allowed to heat for 10 minutes. After 10 minutes, the student removed the four jars and immediately recorded the temperature of the water in each jar.
